children.text: While this curation has looked at each core component of 1930s radio drama - voice, noise, and music - separately, it is of course important to note that the popularity and impact of these dramas was a result of these three components working together. Let's consider one more example of a 1930s radio drama: the Columbia Workshop's 1937 production of Edgar Allen Poe's short story "The Tell-Tale Heart." Pay particular attention to the ways in which voice, noise, and music work together to create a foreboding, increasingly frantic affect for the listener.
